items.title: De Toekomst van Oranje is terug
items.summary: De Toekomst van Oranje is terug. Voetbal International sprak in deze serie in het verleden met toptalenten zoals Cody Gakpo, Brian Brobbey en de gebroeders Timber. Nu is het de beurt aan Isaac Babdi, Gjivai Zechi√´l, Ezechiel Banzuzi en Ernest Poku. We bespreken hun kwaliteiten, valkuilen en dromen!

items.summary: I√±aki Williams is absoluut geen voorstander van het spelen van wedstrijden buiten Europa. De Spaanse Supercopa wordt afwerkt in Saoedi-Arabi√´, maar dat is tegen het zere been van de aanvaller.

items.title: Ronaldo wants 1k goals; open to Europe return
items.summary: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo has reiterated his desire to reach 1,000 career goals before he calls time on his playing career.

items.title: Hakimi returns as Morocco seal AFCON knockouts
items.summary: Africa Cup of Nations hosts Morocco dispatched Zambia 3-0 at a fervid Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium in Rabat on Monday to round off their Group A campaign in style and ease into the round of 16.

items.title: Wrexham into top half of Championship after win
Body language and new-ball woes - Broad's verdict on England bowlers
items.summary: England's batters have taken quite the battering after numerous collapses contributed to a fourth successive Ashes series defeat in Australia.

items.title: Crystal Palace agree ¬£35m fee for Brennan Johnson as race for Spurs forward hots up
items.summary: Figure would be a club-record transfer for Palace Johnson yet to decide with Bournemouth also interested Crystal Palace have agreed a club-record ¬£35m fee with Tottenham for Brennan Johnson but are facing strong competition from Bournemouth to sign the Wales forward. Palace are desperate for reinforcements in attack after a punishing schedule that has seen them play 30 games in all competitions this season because of their Conference League commitments. With Senegal forward Isma√Øla Sarr away at the African Cup of Nations, the club identified Johnson as their primary target for the January window and opened talks with Tottenham several weeks ago. Continue reading...

items.title: Na eerder gesteggel krijgt Marseille 'Auba' ook nog geblesseerd terug van Gabon
items.summary: Het Afrika Cup-avontuur van Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang is abrupt ten einde gekomen. De 36-jarige spits heeft een dijbeenblessure opgelopen en is door de Gabonese voetbalbond per direct vrijgegeven aan Olympique Marseille. Gabon moet tijdens het laatste groepsduel met Ivoorkust dus zonder zijn sterspeler stellen.

items.title: Bondscoach Egypte laakt Afrika Cup-beslissing en wijst naar Europa
items.summary: Hossam Hassan, de bondscoach van Egypte, heeft zich uitgesproken tegen de beslissing om de Afrika Cup minder frequent af te werken. Het continentale toernooi zal niet langer eens in de vier, maar eens in de twee jaar worden gespeeld. Daarmee komt een einde aan een traditie van tweejaarlijkse organisatie die teruggaat tot 1957 en die kritiek heeft opgeroepen bij sommige coaches.

items.title: Johnson to decide future after Palace deal agreed
items.summary: Brennan Johnson is set decide whether he wants to join Crystal Palace after the south London club agreed a ¬£35m deal to sign the Tottenham attacker.

items.title: What will women‚Äôs football in England look like in 10 years‚Äô time?
items.summary: With the club game hurtling along a Premier League-trodden path, women‚Äôs football is at a crossroads Where will women‚Äôs football in England be in a decade‚Äôs time? How can we possibly begin to imagine the scale of the interest, attendances and participation then? How will the game on the pitch have developed, with each generation of players training and playing in better and better environments and at younger ages? In truth, it‚Äôs near impossible to make even educated guesses. Women‚Äôs football in England is at a crossroads. The Women‚Äôs Super League and Women‚Äôs Super League 2 are now run independently of the Football Association, leading to increased outside investment, the rise of multi-club ownership groups, and the million-pound transfer barrier being broken twice in one summer. Minimum standards in the WSL and WSL2 have also been extended or raised, and while there is always talk of maintaining the connection between players and supporters, the women‚Äôs game is hurtling along a Premier League-trodden path at a fierce pace. Continue reading...

items.summary: Champions have conceded 12 set-piece goals in league Arne Slot expressed his dismay before Wolves game Liverpool have parted company with their first-team set-piece coach, Aaron Briggs, in response to the weaknesses that have blighted Arne Slot‚Äôs side this season. Slot has made no secret of his dismay with Liverpool‚Äôs set-piece failings at both ends of the pitch, and admitted they were holding back the Premier League champions before Saturday‚Äôs 2-1 win over Wolves. Continue reading...

items.title: Coventry to back Lampard with transfer funds in January and keen to extend contract
items.summary: Championship leaders expected to strengthen team Club may start talks on deal for head coach next month The Coventry owner, Doug King, is preparing to back Frank Lampard with a significant transfer budget next month as the club chase a return to the Premier League after 25 years and is also ready to open talks over a new contract for the head coach. Lampard‚Äôs side suffered their first home defeat since April in losing to third-placed Ipswich on Monday night but retain an eight-point lead over Middlesbrough at the top of the Championship having lost only three of their 24 league games this season. Continue reading...

items.title: Liverpool set-piece coach leaves club amid woeful record this season
items.summary: Liverpool set-piece coach Aaron Briggs has left the club midway through a season in which the Reds have the joint-worst set-play record in Europe's big five leagues.

items.title: Prominent owner Sheikh Mohammed Obaid Al Maktoum dies
items.summary: Trainer Karl Burke paid tribute to Sheikh Mohammed Obaid Al Maktoum following the leading owner and breeder‚Äôs death on Monday.

items.title: Tiger turns 50 - but when will he return to competitive golf?
